course.name: Literature and Philosophy: Ethics of Eating
course.description: Literature and Philosophy: Ethics of Eating (offered spring only)Sustainably farmed carrots, pastured chicken eggs, grass-fed beef, Frankenfoods: What does it all mean, and what does it have to do with us? This course explores food-production and consumption issues, seeking answers to essential questions that are central to the way we live our lives. While the course naturally incorporates discussion of the science related to the major topics and essential questions, its primary focus is on the aesthetic, cultural, moral, and ethical dimensions of the many choices we make when we decide what to eat.
